column4: is there a way to get rid of gnome without getting rid of ubuntu and then putting xubuntu on it?
sure, just remove gnome.
http://www.psychocats.net/ubuntu/purekde where it says "remove ubuntu"
-doc, -marketing, or -offtopic would be better places to ask
They're identical
http://www.thinkwiki.org/wiki/Category:X31
Yes please make him take it elsewhere.
the top radio button
yes, but that radio button has text over the top of it.
In which browser?
which version? (Ubuntu version will suffice)
File a bug about it on LP
https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu-website
alright.
you're looking for audio loopback.
okay this sounds promising.
or if its just a once-in-a-while thing, you can switch to a TTY and restart gdm
Debian (and therefore Ubuntu) don't have differences in the general purpoes runlevels (you could certainly set some up though)
maybe it would be a better learning experience to install and dual boot Ubuntu Server
Server doesn't either.  If you want to turn off your GUI, just ctrl-alt-f1 and stop gdm (sudo /etc/init.d/gdm stop)
oh cool and then you can start it up again with sudo /etc/init.d/gdm start I guess
anyway to comment out or prevent gdm from starting by default?  what about just changing the name of gdm to gdm-temp-disabled
Use update-rc.d to disable it in your chosen runlevel(s)
Or BUM, obviously.
